util

Class InputChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.InputChecker

  • public class InputChecker
extends java.lang.Object

    A convenience class containing many useful methods. The class is purely static.

    Author:
    Fredrik Bakke, Bj√∏rn Kristian Punsvik

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty(java.lang.String s)

        Determines wether the String is empty.

        What defines an empty String is one or more of the following descriptions:

        • it is null
        • it contains no characters
        • it contains only white space

        Parameters:
        s - the String
        Returns:
        true if the String is empty, false otherwise

      • isEMail

        public static boolean isEMail(java.lang.String s)
        Determines wether the String follows the format of an e-mail. Format: *@*.**
        Parameters:
        s - the String
        Returns:
        true if the String follows the format of an e-mail, false otherwise see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/624581/what-is-the-best-java-email-address-validation-method

      • isName

        public static boolean isName(java.lang.String name)

      • splitName

        public static javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> splitName(java.lang.String name)

        Finds the first and last name in the name and returns them in a Pair<String, String> where the key is the first name and the value is the last name.

        If the name contains any middle names they will be returned as part of the first name.

        A name can be in one of the following formats:

        • "Firstname With Middlenames Lastname"
        • "Lastname, Firstname With Middlenames"
        These will return as Pair<>("Firstname with Middlenames", "Lastname").

        Parameters:
        name - the name
        Returns:
        a Pair<String, String> where the key is the first and any middle names and the value is the last name.

      • getDateAtMidnight

        public static java.util.Date getDateAtMidnight(java.util.Date date)
        Takes a Date and returns that date, but with its hour, minute, second and millisecond set to 0. Used to isolate the actual date(day of month of year) from the Date-object.
        Parameters:
        date - the Date
        Returns:
        that date at midnight.
